Name: Group of Three Baboons
Description: A group of three domesticated baboons, modeled from one piece, are depicted sitting on a base in various postures, which give the piece great realism. Although the baboons' features are not detailed, the sculptor successfully conveys the basic characteristics of the animal. He used the cross-hatching technique to show the texture of the baboons' fur. He also traced lines of brown on the surface of each face to imitate the skin of the animal.
